title: JacocoCoverageRunner NoSuchFileException due to '+' in path
body:
### Description of the bug:


When executing `bazel coverage`, JacocoCoverageRunner fails with a `java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException` for dependencies that include a `+` in the filename. The `+` is being replaced with a space, leading to a file not found error:
```
$ bazel coverage ...
Exception in thread "main" java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: /Users/rsalvador/.cache/bazel/b6de016d545fc335c6fe85486d422c54/external/sfdc_infomodel_info_model_snapshot/info-model-snapshot-0.0.16 20200322.0209.jar
    at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.translateToIOException(UnixException.java:92)
    at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:111)
    at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:116)
    at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributeViews$Basic.readAttributes(UnixFileAttributeViews.java:55)
    at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.readAttributes(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:149)
    at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.readAttributes(Files.java:1764)
    at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$Source.get(ZipFile.java:1428)
    at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$CleanableResource.<init>(ZipFile.java:756)
    at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$CleanableResource.get(ZipFile.java:873)
    at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:271)
    at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:200)
    at java.base/java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(JarFile.java:363)
    at java.base/java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(JarFile.java:334)
    at java.base/java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(JarFile.java:273)
    at com.google.testing.coverage.JacocoCoverageRunner.main(JacocoCoverageRunner.java:454)
```
the correct path should be:
```
/Users/rsalvador/.cache/bazel/b6de016d545fc335c6fe85486d422c54/external/sfdc_infomodel_info_model_snapshot/info-model-snapshot-0.0.16+20200322.0209.jar
```

### Which category does this issue belong to?


Java Rules

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


_No response_

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


MacOS and Linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 6.4.0

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse master; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text
3e476d2677dc93a460a63ce06d063a73e6e26349
```


### Is this a regression? If yes, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced.


_No response_

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

_No response_

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_
